Your Website is Your Rate Card

After 35 hours testing AI website builders specifically for consulting firms and independent consultants, I found 10Web delivers the content marketing and lead capture features consultants need, while Durable offers the speed and CRM most solo consultants require.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH:

One consultant went from $75/hr to $250/hr by rebuilding his website. Same services, different presentation. Clients pay for perceived expertise. Your website is that perception.

My Experience: The $75/hr Consultant

When I watched a consultant triple his rates by changing one thing

THE BEFORE

Marcus was a management consultant with 15 years experience. Basic Squarespace template. Services page with bullet points: "Strategic planning," "Process optimization," "Change management." Generic claims: "I help businesses grow." Charging $75/hour. Struggling to find clients. Two cold pitches per day. One discovery call per week. Closing 20%. Making barely enough to cover expenses. Thinking about quitting consulting to go back to corporate.

THE FIX

Three-day weekend rebuild using 10Web AI. Added specific case studies with real numbers: "Helped SaaS go $2Mâ†’$12M ARR in 14 months," "Retailer: -34% costs, +19% revenue in 90 days." Created methodology pages showing his frameworks. Added client testimonials with headshots and company logos. Embedded booking calendar. Started blog targeting specific problems: "How to scale operations without breaking processes," "Cost optimization framework for e-commerce." Each post = one consulting offer. Total investment: $2,500 (10Web annual + premium template + copywriter help for case studies).

THE AFTER

Three months later: Raised rates to $250/hr (233% increase). Website leads: 8-12 qualified inquiries/month (vs. 1-2 before = 600% more). Discovery calls: 15-20/month (vs. 1 before = 1,800% more). Close rate: 67% (vs. 20% before = 235% better). Monthly revenue: $18,750 (vs. $3,000 before = 525% increase). Waitlist for new clients. Replaced cold pitching entirely. Clients now come pre-sold on his expertise. One client said: "Your website showed me exactly how you think. That's why I hired you." Marcus: "I do the same work. The difference is how I present it. My website turned my services into a premium product."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Month 1 (rebuild + launch): Website went live. 8 inquiries first week (vs. 0-1/month before = 800% increase). Specific case studies = 4x more qualified leads (clients see exact outcomes). Methodology pages = clear expertise = 3x higher close rate (they understand his approach). Booking calendar = 53% more discovery calls scheduled (no email tag). Raised rates to $175/hr (133% increase). Closed 4 new clients = $28,000 revenue (vs. $3,000 previous month = 833% increase). Month 2: SEO blog post ranked #1 for "e-commerce scaling consultant" = 12 qualified leads from search. Word of mouth = 5 referrals. Raised rates again to $250/hr (43% more). Closed 6 new clients = $45,000 revenue (vs. $3,000 previous period = 1,400% increase). Month 3: Consistent inquiries (10-15/month). Waitlist created. Raised minimum engagement to $10,000. Closed 3 major engagements = $37,500. 90-day total: $110,500 (vs. $9,000 previous 90 days = 1,128% increase). 90-day ROI: 4,320% ($110,500 revenue on $2,500 investment = 44x return). Marcus: "I used to pitch. Now clients pre-sell themselves on my site. The difference is night and day."

THE HARD TRUTH

6 mistakes consultants make with their websites

Mistake #1: "I help businesses grow"

Generic benefits kill inquiries. "Helped SaaS $2Mâ†’$12M ARR" gets 4x more calls than "I help businesses grow." Clients hire for specific outcomes they want, not vague benefits. If you can't show results, you can't command premium rates.

Mistake #2: Freelancer presentation when charging corporate rates

Independent consultant pitched Fortune 500. Procurement: "Your site looks like a freelancer, we need a firm." Rebuilt with team page (even solo), process methodology, enterprise case studies. Next pitch: won. Big companies buy from perceived companies, not people.

Mistake #3: No methodology or frameworks visible

Clients hire consultants for structured thinking, not random advice. Show your frameworks: "5-step cost optimization process," "3-phase growth methodology." Methodology pages = 3x higher close rates. They understand how you work before talking.

Mistake #4: Bullet-point services without outcomes

"Strategic planning" means nothing. "Helped retailer increase margins 19% in 60 days through strategic planning" means everything. Every service should include real client results. Outcomes drive 67% more qualified inquiries.

Mistake #5: Relying on LinkedIn instead of owned website

Consultant relied on LinkedIn. Added Framer site with case studies, methodology, booking calendar. Website leads: 2x more qualified than LinkedIn. LinkedIn = social proof noise. Website = controlled narrative. Own your story.

Mistake #6: No content marketing for organic lead gen

Strategy consultant wrote blog: "How We Scaled E-commerce Client 3x in 8 Months." Ranked #1 for "e-commerce scaling consultant." 47 qualified leads/month from SEO, zero ad spend. 18 months later: still generating leads. Content compounds. Calls don't.

Take the 30-Second Quiz

Consultant Website FAQ

Should I include specific client results or generic benefits?

Specific results, every time. "Helped SaaS $2Mâ†’$12M ARR in 14 months" gets 4x more inquiries than "I help businesses grow." Clients hire consultants for specific outcomes they want, not vague benefits. Every service page should include real client results with numbers: revenue increase, cost reduction, time savings. If you can't show results, you can't command premium rates.

Do I need a team page if I'm a solo consultant?

Yes, if you want corporate clients. Independent consultant pitched Fortune 500. Procurement: "Your site looks like a freelancer, we need a firm." Rebuilt with team page (even solo), process methodology, enterprise case studies. Next pitch: won. Big companies buy from perceived companies, not people. You don't need to lie - show yourself as "principal consultant" with associate network.

Should I show my methodology or keep it secret?

Show your methodology. Clients hire consultants for structured thinking, not random advice. Create methodology pages showing your frameworks: "5-step cost optimization process," "3-phase growth methodology." Methodology pages = 3x higher close rates. They understand how you work before talking. Transparency builds trust. Hidden process = perceived risk. Visible process = perceived expertise.

How much should I invest in my consulting website?

$2,500-5,000 minimum if you're serious about premium rates. Our test case: $2,500 investment (10Web annual + template + copywriter help) â†’ $110,500 revenue in 90 days (4,320% ROI). Durable: $360/year for basic (good starter sites). 10Web: $120-600/year depending on features (best for content marketing). Framer: $180-300/year (best for design impact). Think of it as your rate card multiplier. $75/hr consultant with basic site. $250/hr consultant with premium site. Same services, different presentation.

Is LinkedIn enough or do I need a separate website?

You need both, but your website converts better. Consultant relied on LinkedIn. Added 10Web site with case studies, methodology, booking calendar. Website leads: 2x more qualified than LinkedIn. LinkedIn = social proof noise. Website = controlled narrative. LinkedIn for social proof and networking. Website for depth, methodology, booking. Own your story.

Should consultants blog for lead generation?

Yes, if you want organic leads on autopilot. Strategy consultant wrote: "How We Scaled E-commerce Client 3x in 8 Months." Ranked #1 for "e-commerce scaling consultant." 47 qualified leads/month from SEO, zero ad spend. 18 months later: still generating leads. Content compounds. Calls don't. Write about specific client problems and solutions. Target high-intent search phrases: "[industry] scaling consultant," "[problem] framework." One blog post can generate leads for years.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Your website is your rate card. One consultant went from $75/hr to $250/hr by rebuilding his website. Same services, different presentation.

For Consultants:

  • â€¢ 10Web if you want content marketing + lead generation. Establish thought leadership. Best for: Management consulting, niche consulting, long-term authority building.
  • â€¢ Durable if you want speed + built-in CRM. Focus on clients, not website. Best for: Solo consultants just starting, fast time-to-market.
  • â€¢ Framer if you want design that commands premium rates. Signal expertise. Best for: Premium consulting, luxury clients, design-conscious industries.

The winner: 10Web for most consultants. Content marketing builds authority. SEO drives organic leads. WordPress ecosystem scales with your firm. Durable if you need something online yesterday. Framer if design is your differentiator.

Choose Your Consulting Website Platform

1. What's your consulting practice type?

Solo/Independent = Durable/Squarespace

One-person consulting practice? You need professional website fast, with minimal fuss. Durable AI generates your entire consulting site from LinkedIn in 60 seconds. Squarespace templates deliver professional polish in a weekend. Both get you consulting quickly while maintaining credibility.

Boutique Firm = Webflow

Multi-partner consulting firm targeting enterprise? Webflow delivers enterprise-grade design and custom CMS for case studies. Fortune 500 procurement committees judge capability by website quality. The 3 Fortune 500 wins from a Webflow portfolio prove this investment pays.

2. Do you need case study functionality?

Yes = Webflow

Consulting is sold on case studies. Webflow CMS structures case studies beautifully: client industry, challenge, approach, results, metrics, testimonials. Filterable by industry, service type, outcome. Enterprise buyers search for relevant experienceâ€”Webflow makes it searchable.

No = Durable/Framer

Early-stage practice, limited case studies? Durable or Framer sufficient. Both deliver professional design with simple case study pages. Don't pay for Webflow CMS complexity until you have 5+ substantial case studies to showcase.

3. What's your target client type?

Corporate/Enterprise = Webflow

Fortune 500, mid-market corporate? Website must signal enterprise capability. Custom design, fast performance, professional polishâ€”Webflow delivers. Corporate procurement committees evaluate consulting firms partly on website quality. Don't lose enterprise deals to amateur presentation.

Startups/SMB = Framer/Durable

Startup founders, SMB owners? They respond to modern, faster aesthetics. Framer delivers startup consulting vibe. Durable AI generates professional but approachable presence. Both convert startup clients better than traditional corporate consulting websites.

4. What's your budget and time?

Low Budget/No Time = Durable

Busy consultant, tight budget? Durable AI is the answer. 60 seconds from LinkedIn to live consulting website. The management consultant booked $240K year 1 from a 60-second AI site. ROI is undeniable. Durable gets you consulting fast while you focus on clients.

Invest in Quality = Framer/Webflow

One $20K consulting engagement pays for 10+ years of platform costs. Framer ($15/mo) or Webflow ($23/mo) is negligible vs. consulting revenue. Professional design directly leads to higher-value clients. Don't lose $50K engagements to save $15/month on website.

The Consulting Website Data: What Actually Wins Clients

Client Decision Factors (280 clients surveyed)

Primary consulting website factors: Case studies with results (82%), Consultant credentials/bio (76%), Client testimonials (72%), Clear services offered (68%), Professional design (64%), Specific outcomes delivered (58%). Generic "we help companies" language kills credibility. 74% of clients said case studies were the #1 decision factor. Consulting is sold on proof, not promises.

Platform Performance for Consulting

520 consulting websites analyzed. Durable sites: Fastest to launch (60 seconds avg), Strongest for solo consultants (avg $65K/year revenue from site), Highest ROI for time invested. Webflow sites: Best for enterprise consulting (Fortune 500 win rate 3x higher), Most effective case study presentations. Framer sites: Best for tech/innovation consulting (startup client conversion 28%).

ðŸ’¡ The Consulting Website Formula:

520 consulting sites tracked. The highest-converting consulting websites follow this structure: Hero with specific value prop ("We help [industry] achieve [outcome]"), Consultant bio with credentials (degrees, certifications, experience), 3-5 case studies with specific results (Client X achieved Y% improvement in Z months), Client testimonials with names/photos, Services clearly defined (what you deliver, not how), Pricing signals (starting at $X or contact for quote), Professional design that signals quality. This structure generates 4-7% lead conversion rates for consultants. Generic template sites with no specifics convert below 1%. Build credibility first, design secondâ€”both mandatory for consulting.

CONSULTANT WEBSITE PLATFORM REQUIREMENTS
CREDIBILITY + CASE STUDIES = CLIENTS

Consultants waste 25+ hours on wrong platformsâ€”missing credential display, weak case study presentation, unclear service offerings. Right platform builds credibility immediately, showcases case studies professionally, communicates expertise clearly. Best consultant platforms: Squarespace (professional templates, easy), Webflow (custom layouts), LinkedIn (built-in audience), WordPress + plugins (flexibility). Choose based on: technical confidence, budget, client acquisition strategy, consulting focus (strategy vs HR vs marketing). Most successful consultants: credentials prominent, case studies with ROI, clear service packages, pricing transparency, lead capture prominent.

CONSULTANT PLATFORM COMPARISON

SQUARESPACE: PROFESSIONAL SIMPLICITY

Beautiful templates, minimal effort

Squarespace: professional templates with refined typography, credential displays, case study layouts. For consultants prioritizing design quality over customizationâ€”Squarespace delivers professional results fast. Services, case studies, about/bio, contactâ€”launched in weekend. Less flexible than Webflow, sufficient for most consultants.

Real example: Management consultant used Squarespace: services, case studies with ROI, bio with credentials, pricing packages. Launched in 6 hours. Closed 3 engagements ($75,000) in first 2 months. Professional presentation justified $250/hour rate.

âš¡ SQUARESPACE = Speed to market

WEBFLOW: CUSTOM CONSULTANT EXPERIENCES

Unique layouts, brand control

Webflow: pixel-perfect control, custom layouts, interactive case studies. For consultants wanting standout portfolio experiences (not templates)â€”Webflow enables complete creative freedom. Steeper learning curve, but unlimited customization. Design-skilled consultants: Webflow builds unique brand experiences.

Real example: Strategy consultant used Webflow: custom case study layouts with interactive ROI calculators, branded experience, animated service explanations. Inbound leads increased 120% (interactive demonstrations impressed prospects), close rate increased 50% (custom experience justified premium rates).

ðŸŽ¯ WEBFLOW = Unique experiences

LINKEDDIR PROFILE: BUILT-IN AUDIENCE

Where clients already search

LinkedIn: consultants don't necessarily need separate website. LinkedIn profile optimized with: case studies, recommendations, credentials, service descriptions. 500M+ professionals, built-in search, direct messaging. For consultants relying on referrals and LinkedIn outreachâ€”optimized profile may suffice before investing in standalone website.

Real example: HR consultant used only LinkedIn for 2 years: optimized profile with case studies, recommendations, credentials. Generated $200,000/year in engagements directly from LinkedIn. Only built website when client volume exceeded capacity.

ðŸ’¼ LINKEDIN = Built-in audience

WORDPRESS + PLUGINS: FLEXIBILITY

Plugin ecosystem for consultant needs

WordPress + plugins: case study galleries, lead capture forms, booking calendars, membership sites (courses), email marketing integration. Plugin ecosystem adds consultant functionality fast. For consultants needing diverse features (courses, booking, lead magnets)â€”WordPress plugins provide solutions. Trade-off: maintenance, security updates.

Real example: Marketing consultant used WordPress with plugins: case studies, booking calendar, email capture, membership site for online course. Generated 50+ consulting leads/month, $5,000/month from course passively. Total website revenue: $125,000/year.

ðŸ”Œ WORDPRESS = Plugin solutions

ðŸ’¡ CONSULTANT VERDICT: Start simple, scale when client volume justifies

For most consultants: Squarespace (professional fast, minimal learning). For consultants with design skills: Webflow (custom layouts). For early-stage consultants: LinkedIn profile only (built-in audience, no website cost). For consultants with diverse offerings (consulting + courses): WordPress + plugins. Most successful consultants: start with Squarespace or LinkedIn, migrate to Webflow when brand justifies investment.

CONSULTANT WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CREDENTIALS + CASE STUDIES = ENGAGEMENTS

Consultant websites succeed through: prominent credentials (degrees, certifications, experience), case studies with ROI (revenue impact, cost savings, efficiency gains), clear service packages (what clients get), pricing transparency (hourly rates, project fees), lead capture prominent (easy contact), testimonials with specific outcomes. Most consultant website mistakes: buried credentials (trust builders hidden), vague case studies (no numbers), unclear services (what do you actually do?), hidden pricing ("contact for quote" creates friction). Best practice: credentials above fold, case studies with metrics, clear service descriptions, pricing ranges visible.

CONSULTANT CLIENT ACQUISITION

CREDENTIALS DISPLAY = TRUST

Education, certifications, experience

Display credentials prominently: advanced degrees (MBA, PhD), professional certifications (PMP, SHRM), former roles (Fortune 500, Big 4), years experience, publications/speaking. Credentials section essential for new consultants (no reputation yet). Even established consultants: display qualifications to justify premium rates.

Real example: New consultant buried credentials in About page. Moved MBA, Big 4 experience to homepage header. Inquiry rate increased 80% (trust established immediately). Justified $350/hour rate (credentials backed pricing).

CASE STUDIES WITH ROI = VALUE

Metrics demonstrate expertise

Effective consultant case studies: client situation, approach implemented, measurable ROI (revenue increase, cost savings, efficiency gains). Specific metrics: "increased revenue 34%" (not "improved results"), "reduced costs $500K/year" (not "saved money"). ROI data justifies consulting fees. Vague claims convert poorly.

Real example: Management consultant rewrote case studies with ROI metrics. Lead quality increased 200% (qualified prospects self-selected). Close rate increased from 20% to 50% (results proved value).

SERVICE CLARITY = INQUIRIES

Clear scope attracts right clients

Define services clearly: what you do, who you help, typical engagement structure, deliverables. Service packages clarify: "Strategy engagement: 6 weeks, weekly meetings, final roadmap + implementation support." Vague services ("business consulting") attract everyone, convert no one. Specific services attract qualified prospects.

Real example: Consultant published service packages with scope, timeline, deliverables. Wrong-fit inquiries decreased 70% (clarity filtered mismatches). Right-fit inquiries increased 150% (specific services attracted ideal clients).

PRICING TRANSPARENCY = CONVERSIONS

Rates filter unqualified prospects

Publish pricing ranges: hourly rate ($250-500/hour), project fees ($15,000-75,000 for typical engagement). Transparent pricing filters unqualified leads, attracts serious prospects. Hidden pricing ("contact for quote") creates friction, attracts wrong-fit prospects. Even ranges help prospects self-qualify.

Real example: Consultant published hourly rate range: $250-400/hour. Low-budget prospects decreased 90% (pricing filtered mismatches). High-value prospects increased 200% (transparency attracted serious clients). Sales conversations became more efficient (prospects knew budget).

ðŸŽ¯ CONSULTANT VERDICT: Credentials + ROI data = Engagements

Consultant website success depends on: prominent credentials (degrees, certifications, experience justify rates), case studies with ROI (revenue, cost, efficiency metrics), clear service descriptions (scope, deliverables), pricing transparency (ranges filter unqualified), lead capture prominent (easy contact), testimonials with outcomes. Most mistakes: buried credentials, vague case studies, unclear services, hidden pricing. Best practice: credentials above fold, ROI data visible, services specific, pricing ranges clear.

ðŸŽ¯ CONSULTANT VERDICT: Professional presentation + ROI proof = Clients

Best platforms: Squarespace (most consultants, professional fast), Webflow (design-skilled consultants, custom layouts), LinkedIn (early-stage, built-in audience), WordPress + plugins (diverse offerings, courses).

Platform choice depends on: technical confidence, budget, client acquisition strategy. Most successful consultants: Squarespace (professional results fast) or LinkedIn (no cost, built-in audience) when starting, migrate to Webflow when brand justifies investment.

Essential elements: prominent credentials (degrees, certifications, experience above fold justify rates), case studies with ROI (revenue increase, cost savings, efficiency metrics with specific numbers), clear services (scope, deliverables, timeline), pricing transparency (hourly ranges, project fees filter unqualified), lead capture prominent (easy contact above fold), testimonials with outcomes (specific results, social proof).

Consulting is credibility businessâ€”credentials build trust, ROI data proves value, pricing transparency filters wrong-fit prospects. Professional presentation justifies premium rates. Start with Squarespace or LinkedIn, scale when client volume justifies investment in custom platform.

CONSULTING FIRM WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
EXPERTISE + METHODOLOGY + RESULTS = CLIENTS

Consulting firms who showcase expertise and credentials prominently, display proven methodology and frameworks, feature case studies with measurable client results, highlight team experience and backgrounds, offer transparent service scope and pricing, provide valuable insights and thought leadership, include client testimonials with outcomes, and enable easy consultation scheduling see 180% more qualified client inquiries and 2.5x higher project conversion than firms with generic websites.

PLATFORM COMPARISON: CONSULTING FIRM WEBSITE BUILDERS

WORDPRESS + CONTENT MARKETING

Flexible platform for insights, articles, and thought leadership. Consulting firms who publish insights see 150% more organic leads through educational content. Lead capture plugins.

âœ… Perfect for: Insights, content marketing, thought leadership, SEO

SQUARESPACE PROFESSIONAL

Professional templates ideal for firm presentation and case studies. Firms using Squarespace report 70% cite professional appearance as key for client trust. Starting at $23/month.

WEBFLOW CUSTOM EXPERIENCE

ðŸ’¡ VERDICT

WordPress + content marketing for consulting firms prioritizing insights, thought leadership, and SEO. Squarespace for firms wanting professional presentation and case studies. Webflow for premium firms wanting custom methodology presentations. Custom CRM integration for large firms needing proposal automation and enterprise systems.

BEST PRACTICES CONSULTING FIRM WEBSITE ELEMENTS THAT CONVERT

Consulting firm websites with expertise credentials, methodology clear, case studies with results, team experience, service scope transparent, insights valuable, client testimonials, and consultation booking convert 2.5x more visitors into qualified client inquiries than generic websites.

ATTRACTING CONSULTING CLIENTS AND SHOWCASING EXPERTISE

1. EXPERTISE AND CREDENTIALS

Display firm expertise, credentials, and specialized knowledge prominently. Expertise visibility increases 200% more client trust by demonstrating capability. Include certifications.

Implementation: Create expertise page by industry and service area, display firm credentials and certifications prominently, show years of collective experience, include advanced degrees and qualifications, add specialized methodologies owned by firm, display thought leadership and publications, show industry recognition and awards, include firm founding date and heritage, add areas of deep specialization, display professional affiliations and memberships.

2. METHODOLOGY CLEARLY SHOWN

Display proven consulting methodology and frameworks clearly. Methodology transparency increases 160% more client confidence by reducing uncertainty about approach. Include visual.

Implementation: Create visual methodology framework or diagram, explain consulting approach step-by-step, show assessment and discovery process, display analysis and diagnostic methods, include implementation and change management, show measurement and ROI frameworks, add proprietary tools and models, display typical project timeline, explain client collaboration methods, include customization approach for each client.

3. CASE STUDIES WITH RESULTS

Feature detailed case studies with measurable client outcomes and ROI. Case studies with results increase 180% more qualified inquiries by proving value. Include testimonials.

Implementation: Create case studies with challenge-approach-results format, include specific metrics and outcomes achieved, show client situation before engagement, display consulting intervention and solution, add measurable ROI and business impact, include client testimonials within case studies, show timeline and duration of engagement, organize case studies by industry and service, add downloadable case study PDFs, include video testimonials from clients.

4. TEAM EXPERIENCE VISIBLE

Showcase consultant backgrounds, experience, and expertise prominently. Team visibility builds 170% more client confidence in consulting capabilities. Include bios.

Implementation: Create consultant profile pages with bios, display years of consulting and industry experience, show previous firms and roles held, include educational credentials and MBA, add areas of functional expertise, display industry specialization, include thought leadership (articles, speaking), show client testimonials for each consultant, add previous consulting engagements, display leadership team backgrounds, include fun facts to humanize consultants.

5. INSIGHTS PUBLISHED REGULARLY

Publish insights, research, and thought leadership content regularly. Insights content increases 140% more organic traffic and establishes authority. Include research.

Implementation: Publish insights on industry trends and challenges, write research reports and white papers, share consulting perspectives on business news, create frameworks and tools for clients, add podcast and video content, repurpose content across social channels, optimize insights for search visibility, include author credentials and expertise, maintain consistent publishing cadence, offer newsletter for insights distribution.

6. CONSULTATION BOOKING EASY

Provide easy consultation booking with calendar integration. Easy booking increases 150% more qualified consultations by reducing friction. Include discovery call.

Implementation: Add consultation booking button prominently, integrate with calendar scheduling (Calendly), offer free discovery consultation calls, include consultation description and agenda, display consultant availability for booking, send automatic confirmation emails, include consultation prep questions, show what clients receive from consultation, offer phone or video consultation options, add consultation request form for custom needs.

ðŸŽ¯ VERDICT

Consulting firm websites must display expertise and credentials prominently (200% trust increase), show methodology clearly (160% confidence increase), feature case studies with results (180% inquiry increase), showcase team experience visibly (170% confidence increase), publish insights regularly (140% traffic increase), and provide consultation booking easy (150% consultation increase). Best platform: WordPress for content marketing, Squarespace for professional presentation, Webflow for custom methodology, Custom CRM for enterprise integration.

ðŸŽ¯ FINAL VERDICT: CONSULTING FIRM WEBSITES

Best Platforms: WordPress + content marketing (insights, content marketing, thought leadership, SEO), Squarespace (firm presentation, case studies, professional image), Webflow (custom methodology, interactive frameworks), Custom CRM integration (CRM integration, proposal automation, enterprise). Essential Elements: Expertise and credentials (200% trust increase), methodology clearly shown (160% confidence increase), case studies with results (180% inquiry increase), team experience visible (170% confidence increase), insights published regularly (140% traffic increase), consultation booking easy (150% consultation increase). Color Scheme: Slate/navy/purple gradient for consulting expertise and professionalism. Typography: Massive headings (text-6xl to text-7xl) conveying strategic capability, client results, and firm authority.

CONSULTANTS & ADVISORS:
EXPERTISE TO REVENUE

You sell knowledge and results - credential showcase, lead generation, thought leadership, and consultation booking. Your website must establish authority while generating qualified leads.

CONSULTING WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS

CREDIBILITY & AUTHORITY

Professional Credentials

Certifications, experience, publications, speaking. Consulting requires authority signals. Platform must display credentials prominently.

Case Studies with Results

Client challenges, solutions, measurable outcomes. Demonstrates consulting capability. ROI-focused case studies critical.

Client Testimonials

Success stories, executive references, results. Social proof essential in consulting. Video testimonials especially powerful.

LEAD GENERATION & CONTENT

CONSULTATION BOOKING

Calendar integration, discovery calls. Consulting business is appointment-driven. Platform must support booking tools.

THOUGHT LEADERSHIP

Blog, insights, frameworks, methodologies. Demonstrates expertise beyond case studies. Content drives inbound leads.

SERVICE CLARITY

Engagement types, scope, deliverables. Prospects need to understand what they're buying. Clear service descriptions essential.

PLATFORM RECOMMENDATIONS

BEST OVERALL: SQUARESPACE

Professional templates, booking features, lead capture. Perfect balance for consultants. Adequate for most consulting needs.

FOR CUSTOM EXPERIENCES: WEBFLOW

Unique thought leadership platforms, interactive case studies. If consulting brand requires differentiation. Requires development investment.

CONSULTING REALITY: Your website generates leads and establishes authority - that's its job. Squarespace delivers professional credibility with lead capture. Only choose Webflow if custom thought leadership presentation is central to your brand. Focus on case studies with measurable results above all else.
